result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert W. Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert W. Brown was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  May Not have contact with Heidi B unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Defendant is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP forthwith; 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision.  Sentence is concurrent to 15CF318.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Cash Bond on deposit to be applied between 15CF318 & 15CF730 and if any unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Heidi B. unless permitted by the court.   Appeal Rights given.
Sentencing hearing on March 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

from probation agent Kenya Mason.  Def. has non-compliant with the PSI interview process.  Agent requests sentencing date of 1/15/16 at 10:30 be adjourned.
DOC Agt Kori Merrill called stating she informed DOC Agt Kenya Mason, who is now completing the PSI ordered today, about the outstanding warrant.

DOC Agt Kori Merrill called stating the deft appeared there for his PSI interview but the PSI was already completed prior to his appearing in court on 12/16/15 so a new order for PSI is needed.  Judge Kerkman orders PSI to be completed with deft's cooperation.  Message was left for Agt Merrill that there is an outstanding warrant for deft.

Bench warrant issued for failure to post cash bond by 4:00 P.M. on 12/16/15 and for failure to turn himself in at KSD in lieu of posting of bond.  Def. has $1,000.00 cash bond posted; needs to post an additional $1,500.00 cash to be released.
